rev.comment: corrected spelling: publicly; linked to [[University of San Diego High School]], [[caddy]], [[news conference|press conference]]s
[[WP:AWB|AWB assisted]] clean up and re-categorisation per [[WP:CFD|CFD]]
/* Chronology */ Rmv unsubstantiated sentence as vandalism
/* Chronology */ Removed speculative and incoherent sentence.
/* Chronology */ added fair use image of Amber Frey
/* Evidence */ temp rm fourth pic - See talk page
/* Chronology */ temp rm third pic - See talk page
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.61.206.180|24.61.206.180]] ([[User talk:24.61.206.180|talk]]) to last version by Adnghiem501
I don't think we need Amber Frey pic on this article anymore. The pic happens to have been due to a lack of copyright tag.
/* Chronology */ moved pic to the left
rm category as per [[WP:CFD]] [[Wikipedia:Categories for deletion/Log/2005 November 9|Nov 9]]
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/130.126.161.215|130.126.161.215]] to last version by Evil Monkey
/* Chronology */ date format and metric conversion in parantheses
/* Chronology */ Why does it matter that the prison is "infamous"?
changed link at top from disambiguation page to the only other person named Scott Peterson
rv; proof beyond a reasonable doubt isn't proof beyond all doubt; plus, the case is on appeal
Convicted, no need to equivocate now.
Specifying geographic link, also subclassing from [[People from California]] to [[People from San Diego]]
rv and adding explanation (it is a double murder under California law)
how is this a double murder??
rightsizing (thumbnails bigger than the original picture don't make sense)
edited link; removed POV date of death
changed "fertilizer salesman" to "agriculture chemical salesman" - more NPOV. see talk page
rv (a conviction is far from factual certainty, which "Peterson murdered his wife" would imply)
Removing uncommonly used (and in any case highly inaccurate) epithet
rv; there is no reason to boldface "beach bodies killer"; in fact, maybe it should be taken out altogether
One capitalization change ("Lethal injection" to "lethal injection")
rv, double-murder: in the US killing an unborn baby is illegal, therefore murder
how is this a "double" murder? are you all daft?
/* Chronology */ Why two verbs (became known... emerged)?
Reversion due to vandalism (personal opinions of a jury's decision should not be in the article)
"law enforcement had to find other ways to pin the murders on Scott" Removing this blatant POV
Removed POV and added a few wiki-links
/* Chronology */ trying to de-weird this article a bit
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Derision|Derision]] to last version by Zanimum
Added links, split off part of "Evidence", created and added to "Motive" section
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/172.135.44.85|172.135.44.85]] to last version by EventHorizon
/* Chronology */ fact check, reordered the narrative a bit, removed a small POV
added San Quentin info and link.
Changed grammar regarding the penalty phase (was redundant... three times)
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/67.63.17.27|67.63.17.27]] to last version by Gmcapt
Incorrect Information - Judge can overturn trial until judgment is entered
I never said that it was true that he will be put to death, but we're all open to our own interpretations/
It is NOT TRUE that he has been sentenced to death. Rather, the jury recommended that to the judge.
Link contributes little to information on Peterson
ever hear of an ex post facto law? the last time I checked, they were unconstitutional. Peterson was tried in a California court, for voilating existing California laws
Minor and unimportant footnote in the case, and this entry is about Scott Peterson
